overview: This subject will provide a comprehensive overview of the major psychosocial interventions that have demonstrated evidence of effectiveness in young people. Subject content includes:

• General principles of psychosocial interventions
  • Cognitive Behavioural Therapy for a range of presentations
  • A variety of evidence-based psychosocial interventions for young people
  • Working with families and groups in therapeutic contexts
  • Developing treatment plans
ilo: Articulate the rationale and principles that underlie the therapeutic context
Describe the application of cognitive-behavioural interventions in the treatment of mental ill-health in young people
Describe a range of evidence-based psychosocial interventions for young people
Develop a treatment plan that incorporates a range of psychosocial interventions for working with young people
generic_skills: Capacity to translate knowledge into practice
Ability to find, evaluate and use relevant information
Capacity for logical and independent thought

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Online Quizzes of learning content – two multiple choice quizzes with 10 questions each = 20 questions in total (1% per question)
Graded discussion board – posting fortnightly reflections on learning content and responding to fellow students, with a minimum of 7 posts in total

date_times.contact_hours: Online equivalent to 20 contact hours is made up of 10 hours of lectures and live consultation sessions, and 10 hours of asynchronous discussions and structured online tasks.
